Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!!!! BEWARE. Dirty Rooms, Dirty Business, Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: DMVcamelot
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches in my room, the air condition did not work, the dishes, floors, and toilets were filthy! The sheets were stained w you know what! Stay at a regular chain hotel...TAKE IT FROM ME!!!!! Oh.... they had no toilet paper in the bathrooms too.!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: blacktree0215
Reviews.Content: Just returned from almost two weeks in this great resort. The aprtment was equal to where we live in New Jersey (I could never understand why one takes a vacation, and stays in accomodations that are less than they live at home). Basically, a one bedroom apartment, with full kitchen, two TV's and a great deck, overlooking the ocean. Great eating places nearby. Friendly people at the facility, as well as around the Island. My wife and I have roots in Puerto Rico, so we felt really at home. Can't wait for our next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “emaculate grounds and Premises”
Reviews.Author: thecomentador
Reviews.Content: Exellent getaway with Oceanviews. Stood in a Studio Apartment with the Ocean a short distance away at the Dorado nice Balcony with Bamboo Patio Table and Chairs. Sofa King size Bed. All the comforts of Home in this Villa small very convienient kitchen with Pots Pans and Plates cups and Utensils small and large Refrigidator large Microwave over stove with fan and lighting; Air conditioning Pool and a hot Tub in the Pool area. Only fault that i found was in the Matress could be of a better Quality; Hard on the Knees if you know what i mean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Carmenpont
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at Crescent Cove Villa in Palmas. The Villa rental is run by VIP with offices in Palmas. We were extremely pleased with the experience. The Villa was clean, organized and completely stocked with everything you need for a week stay. The staff at VIP as well as all staff including security and pool maintenance were friendly, hardworking and extremely professional.. I would strongly recommend anyone rent at Palmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: luvccrv612
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took a vacation to Puerto Rico the beginning of April with the intentions of doing quite a bit of sightseeing and enjoying the culture of the island. Villas at Palmas was an exceptional choice. 1. The villa was absolutely beautiful. It was clean, it was spacious. The kitchen provided all of the amenities you could think of and the sights from the balcony were amazing, especially in the morning and at sunset. The beach was only a walk away, and it was great to be able to go as we pleased. I couldnt have asked for a more beautiful place, my friend and I were in awe when we arrived. 2. Service was decent. When we arrived there was some confusion with our reservations and we actually did not have a room. Fortunately, the woman at the front desk made arrangements and we were able to book a room. This was frightening though, because I planned everything through a travel agency and I was shocked that the villas wouldnt take extra precaution to make sure everything was perfect. Besides this discrepancy, everything else was great. 3. The location is probably one of the iffy things about staying here. If you plan on leaving the grounds of the resort, be prepared. One, you must speak spanish or at least know a fair amount before venturing in Humacao. Thankfully, I speak spanish, but my friend does not and he had a very hard time. Two, as far as nightlife goes, your best bet are small roadside bars that serve food and cheap drinks. The music was great, the people were nice, but if you are looking for a more modern and traditional type bar/club you will not find it in Humacao or anywhere nearby. Overall, my stay was absolutely wonderful. I would definitely come back again, especially if I am in need for relaxation, sun, and peace. If you are looking for more of a nightlife scene, you may need to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: newtrackduq
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent two nights at The Villas at Palmas Del Mar. We had a wonderful time! We stayed i villa 602 which is a 1 minute walk to the beach and right on the golf course. It was also VERY close to 2 pools and the Sheraton Hotel (which has several places to eat and a casino). The VIlla was clean and very large for 2 people. It had 1.5 baths. It was very easy to get around the resot in our rental car. I would definitely recommend having a car! We really enjoyed horsebackriding at Ranco Bueno Vista and relaxing on the beautiful beach. The restaurants are a bit pricy on the resort but we really enjoyed Sebastian's for breakfast, the beach bar for lunch, and the Tapas restaurant (at the Marina) for dinner. I would recommend stopping at the market for food before arriving. There is a large kitchen in the villa. The worst part of our stay was the very uncomfortable bed in the villa. it was rock hard. Overall this was a beautiful place to stay, i would definietley recommend it, and i can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service yet!!!”
Reviews.Author: fede17mj
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation at The Villas in Palmas because of the good reviews and price range for the rooms. My dissapointment is really with the management of the hotel and not the facilities themselves. I'm a busy professional in the state in florida, and emergencies do come up. I had a wedding scheduled for the weekend that I had to cancel due to my work emergency. I contacted the hotel first, trying to reach the manager, Jose Pico. He was not available that day but I was told to call back Monday. That was okay with me. When I called back, he was not available again. Tried on Tuesday again and was told to call in half an hour, did that too. Tired of calling already to no avail, I was told that he would not come to the phone and the decision was made already to charge my credit card. Basically, no one was willing to talk to me about what happened. The money was not the most important thing in this matter, and if the manager would have had the decency to at least pick up the phone and attend to my situation I would have probably been satisfied and understood their policy. But avoiding your clients the whole weekend is not the way to deal with people. I'm originally from PR and have travelled widely around the world and have yet to be treated this way in any place. Overall very, very dissapointed with the way management deals with unexpected situaion that could happen to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Away from San Juan and a great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Thedadeo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at Palmas del Mar. We were in a 2 bedroom condo with one bath at the Fairways Court community. We rented a car at the SJU airport and drove about an hour south to get to the Palmas del Mar set of communities. Once through the gate, we found the office for Villas at Palmas after a short drive to the "downtown" section. We brought our GPS from home and it was a great help traversing the island although it could not be relied upon for local stores or restaurants (i.e. it said the closest Walgreens was 30m away when it was actually about 2 or 3 miles in Humacao). Even though our plane was late and we arrived around midnight, there was still someone in the office waiting for us to arrive. Each condo community within the larger community is also gated and manned with a guard 24/7. This was helpful since we had not eaten on the way out and the guard was able to give me directions to a close place out of the community that was open late. The condo was on the second floor with a view of a cement pond lake. The kids enjoyed throwing bread from the patio balcony to the birds and giant lizards. The beach was a bit of a walk but the kids enjoyed the waves and building sand castles. The condo itself was well furnished with a tropical theme. Had a large sunken living and dining area with room for 6 at the dining table. There was a full kitchen with oven, stove, microwave, fridge, dishwasher...everything you would expect. There was also a stacked washer/dryer in the closet. There were 2 bedrooms. One had two twins and the other had a queen. There were 3 televisions (all with cable). It took a couple of minutes to figure out the multiple remotes. One is for the TV (use for turning TV on and off and controlling volume. set the TV to Channel 3). The other remote was for the cable box (point it at the cable box and use it to move through the channels). As stated in one of the other reviews, the shower cold/hot water controls are backwards. We ate breakfast everyday in the condo on the balcony and had the rest of our meals out so we stocked up on breakfast supplies and snacks only. We used the condo as our home base and took day trips. I'd recommend El Yunque rain forest, a snorkel trip on EastWind catamaran from Fajardo, a walk through old San Juan (be sure to feed the pigeons), and the bioluminescent bay. We had a great time overall and would definitely go back. Be sure to bake in enough time to just relax at the pool or beach. Also make sure to reapply the sun screen often since it wears off quickly in the water. Casino at 4points was fun but don't plan on leaving with any money. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific For Sophisticated Travelers”
Reviews.Author: skipmays
Reviews.Content: First of al, the "Villas" is/are not a hotel. They are condos and/or furnished investment properties (studios, 1,2,and 3 bedroom apartments) situated throughout the Palmas del Mar resort complex. So don't expect room service, the usual "hotel" services, amenities or lots of hand-holding. If you need those sort of things, book the Four Points Sheraton (also on the complex). The sophisticated traveler can expect a clean, well maintained, furnished efficiency apartment in a well protected community setting. The Villas are decorated by their individual owners and thus it's tough to describe the decore you might find (our one bedroom Villa was a bit spartan, but clean as a whistle with a bathroom as large as an entire hotel room. Daily maid service even washed the dishes in the dishawsher.). Our Villa was in the "Dorado" community, next to the Sheraton and adjacent to the beach. Temperatures during the day (most of the year) are in the mid eighties with a trade-wind sea breeze keeping the air moving most of the time. Our Villa was air conditioned, but we used open windows and doors (no bugs) and ceiling fans to keep things comfortable. Palmas del Mar is a gated resort area consisting of about thirty sub-gated residential communites that generally tend to cluster around life-style cores that include the beach, tennis, golf, equestarian and boating choices. There are a half dozen or so restaurants on the expansive property that cater to a wide range of tastes and budgets. The seasoned traveler will find the local fare (outside the gates) fun to try as well. Nothing fancy, but potentially loads of fun. Budget conscious visitors can prepare their own meals in their Villas using groceries from several shops or supermarkets in nearby Humacoa. Although golf cart rentals are available on the property, a rental car is an absolute necessity. It's a 45 minute ride from San Juan (unless the rentalcar folks send you via Fajardo..which will take 90 minutes on a good day). Puerto Rican drivers are somewhat agressive and seem to view traffic control devices and signs as "advisory" so highway caution is always appropriate. Enjoy Puerto Rico. The weather is usually perfect (including a daily shower that dries off quickly). The people are generally hospitible and helpful. We have been visiting PR for well over thirty years and have found the Villas to be an excellent travel value (considering what you receive).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Room”
Reviews.Author: shadow362
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom in the FairCourts section. It had 2 bathrooms, a gorgeous entry way, beautiful furniture in the living room, dining room, and outside furniture. We were on the first floor, so walk outside to your patio furniture, beautiful landscaping and the pool was very close too!! We just got lucky with our room location, it was the best in the entire complex. I noticed other patios didn't have the nice furniture we had and we had the best location to the pool. It was beautiful. But not a good location for going to the beach. We had to cut through the Sheraton, and it was a good walk. The beach wasn't even nice, seaweed, redish color sand. If you had a key card to open the gate on the side of the property it would have cut the walk time in half, but they didn't give us one, so we had to walk out of the complex through where the cars come in which was the opposite direction of the beach/sheraton. Probably a 15 minute walk. If you like tennis this complex was close to the tennis courts. They have many other complex's which I can't compare, but maybe some are better than others. The only real downside is there is no one to help you if you have questions. No concierge, and your pretty much on your own. It rained one day and there was nothing to do! We went to the casino at the sheraton, it was very small but the only thing we could do on a rainy day. Getting there was no problem from SJU, we got a navigational system, which worked great, I couldn't have got there without it. Took about 45 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What the Dr. prescribe...relaxxxxxx!”
Reviews.Author: mayapr99
Reviews.Content: This is a condo setting, for total relaxation. Not the busy hotel setting. We were there Mon and Tues, our building was empty, not a problem for us we like quite and intimate time. We stayed at the Playa Dorada building. It was absolutly wonderfull. At night we walk to the casino at the Four Points Sheraton. It was busy. The beach was clean, be aware of four foot waves, lots of fun for the thrill seekeers. We rented a golf cart and it was fun. Tour the whole property, palmas del mar is like a dream place....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Villas At Palmas”
Reviews.Author: OhNina
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 3 kids, ages 10,11,13 at the Villas at palmas in Humacao. We rented a car from the San Juan air port. The freeways were a little confusing and the signs are in Spanish, but we had a navigation system that saved us. I thought we were staying in a hotel setting, but it is condo's. They were very well kept and large. I loved having a full kitchen and a washer/dryer. We went for the garden view, but had a great ocean view anyway. The grounds are gorgeous. There are several restaurants inside Palmas Del Mar, most of them a little pricey, but very good. The ocean was pretty, but they have an undercurrent that you need to be careful of. We loved visiting the El Yunque rain forest and the fort in El Moro as well as San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “loved the beach villa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with the beach villa at Palmas Del Mar. We were in a 1 bedroom 2 bath villa right on the beach, not 50 feet from the ocean. The service was nice the people were very friendly and helpful in finding us things to do. Everything in the villa worked fine and we even had a washer and dryer. We hope to return next year with the whole family. No regrets.
